hints.content:
The area is the number of unit squares it takes to cover the rectangle.

![Same rectangle with width labeled 7 and height labeled 8.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/106a454df1b101058c1afd2e74e81ca5325fb75b)

The rectangle has $\tealE{8}$ rows with $\goldE{7}$ unit squares per row.

###Repeated addition

We can find the area by adding the unit squares from each column:

$\underbrace{\tealE{8}+\tealE{8}+\tealE{8}+\tealE{8}+\tealE{8}+\tealE{8}+\tealE{8}}_{\goldE{7}\text{ columns}}$

###Multiplication

We can also write repeated addition as multiplication:

$\tealE{8}+\tealE{8}+\tealE{8}+\tealE{8}+\tealE{8}+\tealE{8}+\tealE{8}=\tealE{8} \times \goldE{7}$

We multiply $\goldE{\text{width}} \times \tealE{\text{height}}$.

We can use these expressions to find the area of the rectangle:

- $8+8+8+8+8+8+8$
- $8 \times 7$

question.content:
![a square.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3a1c2a3379abca2dfdc6c6e257f3ca36dcdcca9c) is $1$ unit square.

![a rectangle 7 squares wide and 8 squares high.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/141b410a61c213c8eefbf10b1cd70c5c5c3278d2)

**Which expressions can we use to find the area of the rectangle?**
